about.philosophy:
We create animation where technology meets heart,
where every frame is a breath between the past and the future.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.description: Bold projects require bold solutions. We are not afraid to experiment with form and content.

technology.title: Technology
technology.description: From classic hand-drawn animation to VR — we master the full spectrum of modern tools.

soul.title: Soul
soul.description: Behind every pixel lies a human story. We don't just animate objects — we bring feelings to life.

contact.intro:
Have an idea?
We'll help present it to your audience.

portfolio.title: Projects
portfolio.intro:
Let's be honest: we love inventing things to do.
Look! Isn't it interesting?

peizazh.title: Landscape Waiting
peizazh.subtitle: Documentary animated short film • 2025
peizazh.tagline: A contemplative walk through the landscape of anxiety.
peizazh.description: An exercise in capturing anxiety scattered in space, in people and in the author’s head.
peizazh.credits: Director: Mariia Sediaeva | Sound: Evgenij Rudakov | Producer: Marina Razbezhkina
awards: Message to Man International Film Festival

mify.title: Myths about God, Hephaestus, and the Construction Brigade
mify.subtitle: Animated sequence for documentary feature film • 2025
mify.tagline: Divine myths captured on a construction brigade jacket.
mify.description:
Alexey Fedorchenko’s film 'Myths about God, Hephaestus, and the Construction Brigade' is dedicated to the 55-year history of the 'Hephaestus' student construction brigade from the Ural Polytechnic Institute, which built projects all across the Soviet Union during their summer practices.

Our studio created animated sequences for the film with a total duration of 10 minutes. To solve the artistic challenge—telling Ancient Greek myths associated with the god Hephaestus through imagery familiar to brigade members—we chose the following stylistic approach: the entire narrative unfolds on the surface of a 'tselinka' (a special student brigade jacket), while all characters, locations, and special effects are represented by elements that no 'battle-hardened' tselinka is complete without: badges, patches, and drawings directly on the jacket.
mify.credits: Animation Director: Mariia Sediaeva | Animators: Liza Konysheva, Daria Puchkova, Ksenia Starikova

strashnyi.title: Terrible City
strashnyi.subtitle: Documentary animated short film • 2024
strashnyi.tagline: Immersive animation unfolding before the wheels of a night tram. Three scary stories that happened to three different people in Yekaterinburg.
strashnyi.description: In the dark cabin of the tram driver, the city is visible through the windows. The rails run ahead, twisting. Houses and bus stops flash by on the sides. Off-screen, we hear three stories that follow each other, and through the windows we see how the events described in the stories unfold right before our eyes.
strashnyi.credits: Director: Mariia Sediaeva | Screenplay: Sabrina Karabaeva | Animation: Danil Strizhov | Sound: Evgenij Rudakov

bum.title: BOOMBOOM: Save the planet!
bum.subtitle: Promotion of the 'BOOMBOOM: Save the planet!' animated series • 2024
bum.description:
'BOOMBOOM: Save the planet!' is an adventure animated series in which various ecosystems compete for survival on planet Earth, while the planet itself has its own unique perspective on the matter.

As part of the series promotion, we produce the podcast 'How It Was,' where creator and director Mariia Sediaeva discusses the creative journey with various participants—from screenwriters and artists to animators, voice actors, and sound designers.

We also maintain a Telegram blog dedicated to the collaborative process of building the series' original universe.

gospodin.title: Mr. Great
gospodin.subtitle: Animated sequence for documentary feature film • 2024
gospodin.tagline: History told through Radziwill chronicle miniatures.
gospodin.description: “Mr. Great” by Ella Tukhareli is a documentary about the Novgorod Museum-Reserve and the people who create it. Animated sequences were used to illustrate the centuries-old history of Veliky Novgorod. Miniatures of the Radziwill Chronicle were chosen as the visual style.

blokadnaia.title: Siege Mosaic
blokadnaia.subtitle: Development of animation technology • 2024
blokadnaia.tagline: Telling stories of the Siege through animated three-dimensional sculptures made of mosaic smalt.
blokadnaia.description: Development of a production technology for smalt-based puppet animation for a feature-length live-action film project by Alexey Fedorchenko, dedicated to the work of mosaic artist Vladimir Frolov’s workshop during the Siege of Leningrad. Our task was to develop a technology that would make it possible to produce 15 minutes of three-dimensional smalt animation within three months. As a solution, we selected and successfully tested motion capture of actors and puppets, followed by simulation into a sculptural, moving smalt image using generative diffusion-based neural network models.

chto.title: What I am doing here?
chto.subtitle: Feature length animated documentary • 2017
chto.tagline: Two young women decide to take on cinema in the most unexpected way possible.
chto.description: Masha and Sabrina, inexperienced but passionate filmmakers, are making an unconventional animated documentary series. They have neither money nor connections, but they do have a strong desire to make films and plenty of free time. Episode by episode, they build the series—until eventually they begin making films separately. Yet it feels as though something in their shared experience remains unfinished. «We should bring the episodes together into a feature-length anthology,» Masha suggests. «That way our creations will reach the big screen.» Sabrina is skeptical—but willing to give it a try…
awards: LINOLEUM International Contemporary Animation and Media Art Festival (2017, 2018)
Window to Europe — best animation in internet competition (2017)
Women Media Arts and Film Festival (2017)
Kinoproba International Film Festival — Grand Prix (2017)
St. Anna Film Festival — jury diploma «For sincerity and a stirring of life» (2018)

novyi.title: SkotAI
novyi.subtitle: AI-powered short horror film
novyi.description:
The 21st century offers astonishing opportunities for digital and product-driven revolution. But what if progress has a dark side? A small journey into the horror genre, descending into the depths of the meat production industry of the future.

Technology: classical animation and AI animation
Target audience: 18+, working young adults (25–40)

mechty.title: Dreams of Old Age
mechty.subtitle: Socio-cultural project • Laboratory • Web series
mechty.tagline: Learning to enjoy the moment and cherish the present.
mechty.description:
Animated shorts from the lives of two elderly neighbors. We want to remind older people, and ourselves, how to enjoy the moment, feel the present, rejoice in what is, and not mourn for what is already gone and lost.

Project format: a series with an unlimited number of 1-minute episodes. Currently, scripts for 30 episodes, animatics, and visual designs for characters and locations are ready.

spiachka.title: Hibernation
spiachka.subtitle: Feature-length animated film • Fantasy for teenagers
spiachka.tagline: A fearless parkouring mouse on a journey through the world of others' dreams.
spiachka.description:
Sonya, a forest dormouse, parkour enthusiast, and prankster who considers sleep the most boring thing in the world, falls into hibernation against her will. She must navigate a world of others' dreams to find her way out—and find herself.

Project format: feature-length film (75 minutes). Currently, the script synopsis and visual designs for characters and locations are ready.

kapi.title: Capi and Tapi
kapi.subtitle: Animated series • Plush adventures in the Amazon
kapi.tagline: Friendship makes the impossible possible in the deep jungle.
kapi.description:
Two best friends—a Capybara and a Tapir—along with their fierce companion Jaguar, make the impossible possible every day.

Project format: animated series (26 episodes x 6 minutes per season). Currently, the scripts for three episodes, the season's episode-by-episode plan, characters, and the project bible are ready. Preparation for animation tests and team building is underway.

drakon.title: Ordinary Dragon
drakon.subtitle: Animated series • Don't splash ketchup on my tapestry
drakon.tagline: A very proper dragon meets a very improper royal family.
drakon.description:
A very proper dragon meets a very improper royal family.

Project format: vertical animated series (26 episodes x 6 minutes per season). Currently, episode synopses, character designs, the project bible, and a season plan are in development.

services.title: Services
services.intro:
Every project is a dialogue between the artist and the viewer,
between technology and soul, between the idea and its realisation.

polny.title: Feature films and series
polny.description: Original animation projects — from concept to final cut. It's definitely interesting!

animation.title: Animated scenes
animation.description: Atmosphere is made up of details. Titles, graphic and animation episodes will help explain complex topics, awaken and support emotions.

science.title: Popular Science
science.description: We turn complex scientific concepts into fascinating visual stories. Science becomes art.

theater.title: Animation support for performances
theater.description: Animated video art for your theatrical production. This is what the stage is waiting for.

festival.title: Festival projects
festival.description: Viewers expect unique energy from every festival. We undertake to make animated screensavers and full visual design.

museum.title: Museum installations
museum.description: Video exhibits, VR installations and complex video branding of museums and galleries. Art in dialogue with technology.

showreel.subtitle:
Let our work speak for itself —
a story lives in every frame.

team.description:
Our team gathered from different spheres:
Animation, Film, Music, Literature, Fine Arts, IT, Theater.
That's why you see so many logos of different festivals, competitions, awards.
We participated in them, received awards and prizes. But we worked not for prizes, but because we know and love our business.
It's true.

data.title: Personal data we may receive

data.p2: Technical data may be automatically recorded: IP address, browser information, date and time of access. The specified data is processed automatically by the hosting provider GitHub Pages solely for the purpose of functioning and ensuring the security of the site.

transfer.title: Transfer to third parties
transfer.p1: We do not transfer personal data to third parties. Technical information is processed by the hosting provider GitHub.

storage.title: Data storage and protection
